message:
It's 4 in the morning and it's time for a rails question :

If I have a Model user that have many posts and a post belongs to one user "many to one"

How can I get to do another relation in active record to handle the user likes many posts ? "Many to Many"

data.message:
You can add another has_and_belongs_to_many association independent from the existing one...  You can actually do as many associations as you want between the 2 models

The default convention will be one..  But you are not limited to that
does it make sense ? I feel like it doesn't make sense ?

In the "likes"  this is not necessarily HABTM

It could be user has many likes and posts has many likes (if u want to recording the timing of the action for example)

It does make sense 

Think of a post model that has
Reviewer_id and author_Id
Both belong to user.  But capturing different information and meaning

Okay then lets roll it up in the oven !!

Thanks Mahmoud =D
